title: Lewis Hamilton defends himself following criticism of environmental stance
text:
Lewis Hamilton has strongly defended himself against accusations of hypocrisy over his recent environmental stand, claiming that despite his constant global travel as a Formula One driver, he is taking several steps to ensure he ends the year carbon-neutral.

Since he took to Instagram last week to highlight ecological destruction and the virtues of his own vegan diet, Hamilton has faced a welter of criticism over his inconsistent messages. Even Fernando Alonso, his former team-mate at McLaren, said: “You can’t send out a message on one day, and on the next day do the opposite. We all know the lifestyle that Lewis has, and that F1 drivers take 200 planes a year. You can’t then say, ‘Don’t eat meat.’”

Hamilton was bullish in response on Thursday, explaining that he was making positive changes. Having been moved to make his initial statements by the David Attenborough documentary, Blue Planet 2, he said: “It made me sad to see the things we’re not aware of. I’m making a big push to be carbon-neutral by the end of the year. I don’t allow anyone in my office, or my household, to buy any plastics. It all has to be recyclables, right down to things like deodorants and toothbrushes.”
